meanings.definition: To lift or pull something with a sudden, strong movement.
meanings.sent1: She was hoicking the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He hoicked the rope to secure the boat.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried hoicking her toy elephant onto the bed, but it kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: The magician hoicked the rabbit out of the hat with a swift motion.
meanings.sent5: The farmer hoicked the hay bale onto the truck effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: He was hoicking to get rid of the phlegm in his throat.
meanings.sent2: She hoicked before starting her speech to make sure her voice was clear.
meanings.sent3: The comedian hoicked loudly on stage for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The old man hoicked before speaking, causing everyone to turn and listen.
meanings.sent5: The singer hoicked before hitting the high note to ensure a perfect performance.

meanings.definition: A sudden, strong movement or pull.
meanings.sent1: The hoicking of the curtains startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sudden hoicking on the fishing line and knew he had caught something big.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected hoicking of the rug made everyone in the room jump.
meanings.sent4: The hoicking of the door made her heart race with fear.
meanings.sent5: The hoicking of the tree branch sounded like a crack of thunder in the quiet forest.
